ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Life Skills Education Programs for Children and adolescents In urban slums of Indore and Ujjain Prayatna regularly organised the Life Education Program in which Better Life Options training module given by CEDPA is implemented The main aim of this program is to give firsthand knowledge of essential life skills to children The program area is urban slums of Indore and Ujjain Capacity Building programs PRAYATNA is now widely recognized as the focal point for capacity building agency on Child Rights and Protection. PRAYATNA participates and conducts various capacity building programs on Child rights & Protection and Education Each year Prayatna conducted M&E workshops for social development professionals and students Observation of important days and awareness campaign Prayatna observes significant days like International Women day Vaccination Day Children Day World Toilet Day World TB Day and World AIDS Day Prayatna also running awareness campaign on time to time Campaign on Child Rights and Protection Girls Education Mother and Child health are organized throughout the year Prayatna also supports other agencies to run programs and campaign in its intervention area Conducting Surveys and data collection in field Prayatna engaged in conducting surveys on Water harvesting Water quality survey and data collection data analysis and report writing of sanitation program for Asian development Bank Pahal ASRA CAMP and AAS Intervention area was Indore Dewas Sehore Dhar Ujjain Chhatarpur Betul and Mandla districts of Madhya Pradesh Working as a technical support agency Prayatna also works as a technical support agency for other organisation Prayatna assists other organisations in conducting surveys data collection research & analysis report writing proposal making and in organising training programs on child health and education issues Prayatna covers a variety of organisation as its clients all over the Madhya Pradesh mainly from Indore Dewas Dhar and Hoshangabad

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Resource Centre for Adult and Continuing Education (State Resource Centre), Bhopal was established in the year 1995, as a part of National Literacy Mission Authority. It is sponsored by MHRD, GOI to extend academic and technical resource support in the field of adult education and literacy. Primary objective is to push further the agenda of a literate society, primary education, electoral, financial and legal literacy, community development, environmental conservation, health and hygiene and women empowerment. Basic functions are development of teaching learning material (TLM), training of adult education functionaries at state, district, block and panchayat levels, motivational and environment building activities, development and use of multimedia productions in the field, organizing field programs on special occasions, researches in the field of literacy and adult education, evaluation and monitoring of literacy classes, innovative programs in the realm of adult and continuing education and documentation of all the activities. Major Achievements In recognition of its outstanding contribution in the field of Adult Education, SRC Bhopal was awarded the prestigious Saakshar Bharat National Literacy Award. The award was given by the Honorable President of India on 8th Sep, 2014 in New Delhi. The office of Chief Election Officer Bhopal M.P. certified 7 members of SRC Bhopal for their efforts in the field of electoral literacy in 2014. A joint venture with UNICEF by the name youth to youth, whereby the slum dwellers of Bhopal were made literate. Organized a vast, Pustak Yatra along with NBT, Delhi. Hereby, three mobile libraries were taken to 10 lakh people, journeying through 16,000 kms. in 31 districts of the of MP in a period of 30 days. An extensive anti smack drive Ek Jatan was launched with the help of the Health and Police departments for drug addicts of Nayagaon, district Narsinghpur. An extensive campaign was organized against female foeticide, whereby street corner plays were organized to create awareness against this evil practice. The districts were Bhopal, Raisen, Damoh, Panna, Chhatarpur, Teekamgarh and Sagar. Under the Meet the GPBP campaign SRC,Bhopal made positive interventions in as many as seven major states of the country,namely Meghalaya, Assam, Bihar, Chattisgarh, Rajasthan, Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh. Organized 16 Computer Based Functional Literacy camps in 2012, every camp consisted of 40 women and the duration of the camps was of 45 days. Inter Personal Media Campaign was successfully launched on themes of legal literacy, financial literacy, electoral literacy, disaster management and civil defense and offering of Saakshar Bharat. To cater to the literacy needs of the visually impaired, a Braille Primer was developed by the SRC, Bhopal. Convergence with forest department to train their officials, thereby creating awareness among forest dwellers about literacy, legal rights, fuel conservation etc. Jail literacy endeavors for illiterate inmates in various districts jails of Madhya Pradesh. Conduction of Third Party Assessment of 17 Jan Shikshan Sansthans of Madhya Pradesh.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Yaugik evam Atmik Upchar Healing through Yaugik evam Atmik Upchar (Sparsh Chikitsa and Spiritual/General counseling). Regular healing camps are organized from time to time for general public including children, adults, senior citizens and also disease based camps. Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan â€“ Organized a vast level awareness campaign on Polythene Mukt Abhiyaan in Ujjain whereby oaths were being taken in schools by students of themselves not using polythene carry bags and not letting anyone else use it. Youth development â€“ Yuva Diwas Under this activity, since 2011 organizing interschool debate/essay writing and presentation competition with the sole intention of generation awareness about great literature of Swami Vivekananda among todayâ€™s youth. Research Paper Publication Roopantaran did research on human aura through Biopulsar Reflexograph, aura reading device. Three research papers have been published in three different journals. Details as follows: â€¢ Scientific Validation of Ancient Indian Disease diagnosis system using Human Energy Field (Aura) published in National Journal of Community Medicine in 2011 â€¢ Scientific Validation of Ancient Indian Disease diagnosis system using Human Energy Field (Aura) on GIT cases published in National Journal of Medical Research â€¢ Role of Reiki Healing in Diabetic care published in Ojas Panchkarma - Research Journal of Holistic Health Management Participation in Simhastha 2016 pre, during and post activities â€“ Atithi Devo Bhavah â€¢ Clean Ujjain Green Ujjain Campaign â€¢ Awareness generation through nukkad natak, pamphlet distribution - Paati santo ke naam â€¢ Conducted training programs in schools and colleges on responsibility of students and citizens â€¢ Family heritage walk and Cyclothon organized in collaboration with Jila Prashasan and Dr. Hariram Choubey Vichar Manch before Simhastha 2016. Won Golden Book of world records maximum number of participants for both the activity. Clean Kshipra Green Kshipra â€¢ Post Simhasth 2016 Plantation campaign in coordination with Forest department involving school students. â€¢ 30000 plants planted with students and forest department Ganpati Workshop â€¢ 16000 mitti ke Ganesh prior to Ganesh Utsav Magic of Breathing â€¢ Organizing â€œMagic of Breathingâ€ workshops for students before exams so as to help them in easing out their exam stress. In this workshop proper and correct way of breathing is being taught to students which increases their concentration and gives a sense of peace and wellbeing.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Basis of our research is Aura reading which gives better picture of individual’s health, because Aura reflects/covers all the conditions of individual outlined in definition of health according to WHO, which says, “Health is a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.”

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Yuva Rastra Saint Shri Sadguru Bhaiyyuji Maharaj is a spiritual leader, social reformer and motivator, whose sole aim is to bring happiness on the faces of countless poor and downtrodden people, lift them from morass of despair, poverty, social inequality and enable them to live a life of dignity. He is an enlightened saint who has made his life’s purpose to serve humanity, to provide untiring, selfless service for national development and to guide people rightly onto the path of spiritual.
